intro: Rhus rishiriensis, commonly known as the Rishiri holly, is a rare shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
